DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine whether woman overactive bladder ( OAB ) receive direct instillation via catheter Botulinum-A Toxin ( Botox ) Dimethyl Sulfoxide ( DMSO ) solution experience significantly well improvement OAB symptom compare similar group woman OAB receive instillation DMSO .
DOC.brief_title: Over Active Bladder Instillation Study - Botox
DOC.detailed_description: The primary objective study evaluate efficacy catheter-based instillation solution Botox/DMSO novel method treat woman overactive bladder ( OAB ) secondary urinary incontinence fail oral pharmacologic therapy . This study test broad hypothesis administration Botox/DMSO instillation bladder urethral catheter significantly improve symptom quality life patient OAB compare DMSO installation alone . Explicitly , hypothesize score validate Incontinence Quality Life ( I-QOL ) questionnaire woman OAB receive Botox/DMSO instillation much improve three-month follow-up compare similar woman receive DMSO instillation alone . Our long-term goal offer woman detrusor hyperreflexia OAB less invasive alternative surgery alternative anticholinergic mouth medication . In support effort , propose randomize , double-blind , placebo control clinical trial conduct Department Urology Mayo Clinic , Jacksonville , Florida . Note : The study terminate early July 2011 due extend medical absence Principal Investigator .
DOC.criteria: Female patient age 18 year old No evidence stress urinary incontinence physical examination urodynamics Patients fail prior drug therapy overactive bladder detrusor hyperreflexia Patients symptoms sign OAB , detrusor hyperreflexia , urinary urgency , urinary urge incontinence . Patient mentally competent ability understand comply requirement study Patient agree available followup evaluation require protocol Patient give sign informed consent Patient PostVoid Residual Urine ( PVRU ) great 100 ml repeat measure . ( Patient single PVRU > 100 ml follow two consecutive PVRU measurement < 100 ml may include study ) Patient great vesicoureteral reflux grade 1 , interstitial cystitis , genitourinary fistula Patient pelvic organ prolapse stage III IV , i.e . distal part prolapse protrude 1 cm beyond hymen ( > +1 ) , strain Patient uninvestigated hematuria Patient low tract genitourinary malignancy Patient current medication stress urinary incontinence , alphaadrenergic agonist duloxetine , within three week prior complete baseline Bladder Diary ( estrogen therapy stable dose least two month prior study start allow ) Patient ongoing complication prior antiincontinence surgery Patient pregnant , lactate , plan become pregnant within study period Patient receive pelvic radiation Patient condition , could lead significant postoperative complication , include current infection uncontrolled diabetes . Patient morbidly obese ( defined BMI > 40 Kg/m2 ) Patient bedridden , institutionalized physical condition move closest bathroom without assistance another person Patient current acute urinary tract infection , include cystitis urethritis . ( Patient infection treat antibiotic , subsequent urinalysis test confirm absence infection study inclusion ) Patient condition would preclude treatment due contraindication and/or warning study product 's labeling Patient immunomodulatory therapy ( suppressive stimulatory ) Patient know lidocaine hypersensitivity hypersensitivity anesthetic use treatment session/surgical procedure Patient concurrent use another study product within two week prior study start , concurrently participate clinical study Any disease opinion Investigator would make patient unsuitable study Patient life expectancy le 12 month
